alert.note: Alert for Sumter; Webster (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Webster and Sumter Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 545 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Maddox to near Centerpoint to near Troutman, and moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Americus, Preston, Plains, Leslie, De Soto, Weston, Desoto, Cobb, Sumter, Lamar, Croxton Crossroads, Huntington, Leveretts, Maddox, Centerpoint and Dumas. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for west central Georgia.
